Description: Large necked container, maybe a large jar or pottery transport amphora; no handles on the sketch (broken or without handle?). Described as ribbed and 'Roman'.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Chautauqua Institution, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This large container is now lost. Brief description ('large pottery’) with sketch from Chautauqua distribution list of the Egypt Exploration Fund. The sketch is not specific enough ton precisely identify the container. However, it is described as roman and ribbed. and the profile resembles that of Roman gaza amphorae (though this example seems to have lost its small handles), though any identification has to be tentative.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JC.07)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Chautauqua Institution, Chautauqua (NY)
